availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thomas W. Hawkins (Jessamine County, KY, trader & farmer)

body.p: Jessamine County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Hawkins and Mary Hawkins. Married to Elizabeth Hawkins c1850. Trader in Jessamine County in 1850. Farmer in Jessamine County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Jessamine County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 2, p. 50B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, Nicholasville, p. 50B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, p. 44.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jessamine County, District 6, p. 104B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Jessamine County, KY, July 1863, p. 6 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport â€“ Microfilm (before 1911), Ancestry, Lexington, Deaths, vol. 2, 1908, no. 877.
